intro: Crossyne flava, commonly known as the yellow crossvine, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its fragrant, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Crossyne flava is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its showy blooms and adaptability to various garden conditions.
